library(ReefPartitionUniversal)

Generating example raster data

First, we generate an example raster extent using the terra package and an example reef polygon using the sf package.

library(terra)
#> Warning: package 'terra' was built under R version 4.4.3
#> terra 1.8.93
library(sf)
#> Warning: package 'sf' was built under R version 4.4.3
#> Linking to GEOS 3.13.0, GDAL 3.10.1, PROJ 9.5.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE

# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(123)

# Create raster template
r <- rast(ncol=50, nrow=50, xmin=0, xmax=50, ymin=0, ymax=50)
reef_polygon <- st_as_sfc(st_bbox(r))

Next, we generate example habitat data using the raster extent. Habitat NA values indicate no reef habitat of interest and values of 1 and 2 represent reef habitat types 1 and 2 (e.g. inshore/offshore or reef flat/reef slope).

habitat <- r
values(habitat) <- sample(c(NA, 1, 2), ncell(habitat), replace = TRUE)
plot(habitat)

Finally, we generate example bathymetry data. In this example we use the distance of each cell from the centre as an “example” of bathymetry, adding random variation.

# Reef bathymetry layer
xc <- (xmin(r) + xmax(r)) / 2
yc <- (ymin(r) + ymax(r)) / 2

# Compute distance to centre of raster for each cell
coords <- crds(r)  # n x 2 matrix of xy coordinates
dist_center <- sqrt((coords[,1] - xc)^2 + (coords[,2] - yc)^2)

# Assign to raster
bathy <- r
values(bathy) <- dist_center + runif(length(dist_center), -2, 2)

plot(bathy)
